intro: Boerhavia coulteri var. palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's bladderleaf, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils or along dry streambeds. Its structure includes erect stems with opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The species is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy plant in xerophytic habitats.
